instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-02016: What is 820-02016? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVOUT_LCDBKLT: What is PPVOUT_LCDBKLT? PPVOUT_LCDBKLT is the backlight power rail that is responsible for creating a backlight o nthe screen. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Intermittent Display
threads.message:
Hi. Please help.

M1 MacBook with intermittent display, but backlight stays on.
The display stays on for about 1 minute and goes off. Tested with 2 other displays and same issue.
External monitor works fine.
<SIGNAL>PPVOUT_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> - 43.45V after display goes off.

Tested all EDP and LDDP lines in diode mode, and it matches with OpenBoardata values.
 
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_SW_LCD</SIGNAL> - 3.14V when display is on, then goes to 3.23V when display goes off.

Any idea of how to fix it?
Please
Thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Intermittent Display
threads.message:
Possibly problem with data cable inside LCD assembly.
It also fails, not only backlight flex.
Recently confirmed by a friend; however not sure if was M1 machine.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Intermittent Display
threads.message:
You mean the lcd is faulty?
But I tested with another 2 lcd display and the same is happening.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Intermittent Display
threads.message: Changed the small video cable too?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Intermittent Display
threads.message: I've tried with another cable and same issue.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Intermittent Display
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Intermittent Display
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PP5V_SW_LCD</SIGNAL> - stable
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_SW_LCD</SIGNAL> - 3.14V when display is on and 3.25V when display is off.

I've replaced UP701 just to check if it would get any difference, but still same.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Intermittent Display
threads.message:
Lid detection failure should affect backlight too.
But, just in case, monitor <SIGNAL>LID_OPEN</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>AMR_LEFT</SIGNAL>/RIGHT signals.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Intermittent Display
threads.message:
All 3 lines has same voltage after display goes off.
<SIGNAL>LID_OPEN</SIGNAL> - 1.16V 
<SIGNAL>AMR_LEFT</SIGNAL> - 1.56V
AMR_ RIGHT - 1.56V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Intermittent Display
threads.message:
I think <SIGNAL>LID_OPEN</SIGNAL> should be a bit higher, closest to 1.8V; just compare with good board.
Also check it disconnecting trackpad cable.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Intermittent Display
threads.message:
I was testing without trackpad.

RR313 - <SIGNAL>LID_OPEN</SIGNAL>/<SIGNAL>SMC_LID_OPEN_R</SIGNAL> - 1.16V
RR203 - <SIGNAL>IPD_LID_OPEN_1V8</SIGNAL> - 1.8V

I don't have another board at the moment to compare.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Intermittent Display
threads.message: Save data and check if DFU restore helps.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Intermittent Display
threads.message:
I don't know what's going on here.

After DFU revive it went to activation lock screen and guess what, no more screen issues.
Then I went through the activation process to activate the mac and for this I had to set up a Wi-Fi and instantly after turn on Wi-Fi screen went off.
I connected to an external display and turned off the Wi-Fi and closed and opened the lid, display is fine.
So, now I know that if Wi-Fi is on, the screen goes off. Turn off Wi-Fi, close and open the lid, screen works fine.
I have no idea what else to do.
Please help. What's the relation between screen and Wi-Fi?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Intermittent Display
threads.message:
Did you confirm this issue several times?
Is there any way to do DFU restore?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Intermittent Display
threads.message:
Yes, I've tested many times and even checked by someone else to make sure I'm not ðŸ¤ª.
I've done only revive option. This issue I'm mentioning is on restore screen before install system.
I will do dfu restore on Monday.
